result.execSummary:
The defendant Carol R. METZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Sex Offender Registry compliance.

Any contact with minors will be at the agent's discretion, excluding family members who are children.

Use of internet enabled devices will be at the agent's discretion with the exception of employment purposes and functions.

Provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within the first year of probation.

Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on June 9, 2016 at 10:10 am.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 04-21-2016 @ 3:00 p.m.

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.   Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 02-11-16 at 3:30 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours, defendant is to have no contact with any use of internet enabled devices, except at work at JAC Financial and no unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18.  Bail furnished.
